form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: United States Department of Justice, Immigration and Naturalization Service, N-336

full_text: DEPARTMENT @ UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE Immigration and Naturalization Service 300 N. Los Angeles Street Los Angeles, CA 90012 Refer this File No. Candelasia Angel D. Espinoza A 92037.324 to Prepared By: also Date : Dec 17'98 DECISION On July , 6 97 you appeared application for naturalization; and for an examination on your on ale 17. 98 you appeared for reexamination. Pursuant to the investigation and examination on your application, it is determined that you are ineligible for naturalization. Section 312 of the Immigration and Naturalization Act, 8 USC 1423, provides in pertinent part that " [no] person except as otherwise provided shall hereafter be naturalized who cannot demonstrate an understanding of the English language, including an ability to read, write and speak words in ordinary usage in the English language [and] a knowledge and understanding of the fundamentals of the history, and of the principles and form of government, of the United States." 'ou have failed to meet the requirements of Section 312 in that : ] You have failed to demonstrate ability to speak and understand the English language sufficiently to answer the questions in your interview and in your application, and are not exempt from the requirement. You have failed to demonstrate ability to write words in ordinary usage in the English language which were presented to you to write, and are not exempt from the requirement. [ ] You have failed to demonstrate knowledge of the history, and of the principles and form of government, of the United States. This decision is made without prejudice toward the filling of a new application in the future. If you decide to request a review hearing on this decision pursuant to Section 336(a) of the Act, you must file a request for a hearing within 30 days of the date of this notice. If no request for hearing is filed within the time allowed, this is final. A request for hearing may be made to the District Director of the Immigration and Naturalization Services at the above address on Form N-336 (Enclosed), request for Hearing on a Decision in Naturalization Proceedings under Section 336 of the Act, together with a Fee of $110.00 . A brief or other written statement in support of your request may be submitted with the Request for Hearing. Sincerely yours, HAND DELIVERED Candolaia Entruoge ROSEMARY LANGLEY MELVILLE District Director I Enclosure Form N-336 N 335 (1)
